intro: Leptochilus dolichopterus, commonly known as the long-stemmed leptochilus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, elongated stems and finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It is native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its delicate appearance and ecological significance, it is often found in woodland edges and meadows.
